Topic.Title: Alibaba IPO will get YHOO to $25

Message.Msg: The IPO itself will get YHOO to $25 and afterward it all depends how Alibaba Group of Companies will be successful going forward. The market value of YHOO 24% stakes will go with Alibaba as they become successful in their businesses. In the meantime, I value the IPO equate to $25 YHOO per share whether the IPO is valued at $40B, $60B or $80B. .

Message.Title: ALIBABA will IPO because...
Message.Msg: .o..f China's logistic wars. Jingdong Mall just made another round of financing ($700M) to compete against Alibaba's new logistic network. Now is the time for Alibaba group to take on Jingdong Mall. With the IPO resources Jingdong Mall will not be able to compete and Alibaba will take the whole China for ever. Imagine Ebay-Amazon-UPS-Paypal in one company. This is the same size as AAPL, it could be easilly $75B for Yhoo in 2015.

Topic.Title: ALIBABA will IPO because...

Message.Msg: The IPO resources go to current owners, not Alibaba Group. It is they who are selling part of their holdings to the public. Alibaba Group is not selling anything and not getting anything.

Topic.Title: ALIBABA will IPO because...

Message.Msg: Where did you got your MBA in a McDonalds happy meal? The IPO resources go 100% to the company, who then buys out every secondary investor from prior financing (this is part of the pre-IPO negotiations). What is left is fully to the treasure of the company. I

Topic.Title: ALIBABA will IPO because...

Message.Msg: What???? If the company does an IPO, a portion of the proceeds may go to selling shareholders and a portion will go to the company. If the company offers 20% of the equity of the company and 10% of the company (half of that) is being offered by selling shareholders, then the company will get half of the IPO money.

Message.Title: Apple will make a $30 offer before Alibaba IPO's. They need Yahoo to beat Google.
Message.Msg: And, they need Yahoo very badly. We may be able to get $33.

Topic.Title: ALIBABA will IPO because...

Message.Msg: The company does not own any part of itself. The company is 100% owned by shareholders. The company cannot sell something it doesn´t own and keep the proceeds. The company is essentially not doing an IPO, the shareholders are doing an IPO. The shareholders are offering the public a chance to buy some part of their 100% ownership. If there is an Alibaba Group IPO, Yahoo will probably put up some part of the shares offered to the public. Yahoo will get the money from that sale not Alibaba Group.
